pull_request.title: Restore ClusterState version during remote state restore
pull_request.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request, here are some tips:

1. If this is a fix for an undisclosed security vulnerability, please STOP. All security vulnerability reporting and fixes should be done as per our security policy https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/security/policy
2. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md and developer guide https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/DEVELOPER_GUIDE.md
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/TESTING.md
-->

### Description
- During QL remote state restore we do not restore previous cluster state version
- With this change, we intent to restore the cluster state version back.

Resolves https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/issues/10692

issue.title: [BUG] Precommit checks time out connecting to maven central.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: CI
labels.description: CI related

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
I've had multiple PRs fail precommit checks ([example 1,](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/actions/runs/3275199595/jobs/5392386273), [example 2](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/actions/runs/3267306469/jobs/5372908888)) over the last few days connecting to maven central with no [incidents](https://status.maven.org/) reported.  This has happened for all platforms but more frequently for the windows precommit.

Related https://github.com/actions/runner-images/issues/1499.  Suggest we try bumping TTL `-Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=60` and/or retry count.

comment.body: @mch2  Should -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=60 be added in .github/workflows/precommit.yml to both ./gradlew javadoc precommit --parallel and ./gradlew assemble --parallel?

issue.title: Fix match_phrase_prefix_query not working on text field with multiple values and index_prefixes
issue.body:
### Description

When executing match_phrase_prefix_query on a text field with multiple values and setting `index_prefixes` to `true`, the  parameter `position_increment_gap` which defaults to 100 is not used by the sub-field `{text_field}._index_prefix`, this results in the spanNearQuery not working.

This change makes the sub-filed `{text_field}._index_prefix` using the value of `position_increment_gap` when indexing documents, so that a fake gap between multiple values are added. Some unit tests and yml test are added for this change.

### Related Issues

https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/issues/9203

### Check List
- [x] New functionality includes testing.
  - [x] All tests pass
- [x] New functionality has been documented.
  - [x] New functionality has javadoc added
- [x] Failing checks are inspected and point to the corresponding known issue(s) (See: [Troubleshooting Failing Builds](../blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#troubleshooting-failing-builds))
- [x] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff
- [x] Commit changes are listed out in CHANGELOG.md file (See: [Changelog](../blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#changelog))
- [x] Public documentation issue/PR [created](https://github.com/opensearch-project/documentation-website/issues/new/choose)

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.
For more information on following Developer Certificate of Origin and signing off your commits, please check [here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#developer-certificate-of-origin).

comment.body:
### Gradle Check (Jenkins) Run Completed with:
* **RESULT:** FAILURE :x: 
* **URL:** https://build.ci.opensearch.org/job/gradle-check/29136/
* **CommitID:** c9a27b020f8088e90e165527e78c88946df04a7b
Please examine the workflow log, locate, and copy-paste the failure(s) below, then iterate to green.
Is the failure [a flaky test](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/DEVELOPER_GUIDE.md#flaky-tests) unrelated to your change?
Yes I am creating deep copy as we don't have way to stream atomic long so we are creating deep and returning object.

issue.title: [BUG] Flaky test InternalEngineTests.testUnreferencedFileCleanUpFailsOnSegmentMergeFailureWhenDirectoryClosed

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: >test-failure
labels.description: Test failure from CI, local build, etc.

labels.name: flaky-test
labels.description: Random test failure that succeeds on second run

labels.name: Indexing
labels.description: Indexing, Bulk Indexing and anything related to indexing

labels.name: Indexing:Replication
labels.description: Issues and PRs related to core replication framework eg segrep

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Flaky test failure : `org.opensearch.index.engine.InternalEngineTests.testUnreferencedFileCleanUpFailsOnSegmentMergeFailureWhenDirectoryClosed`

```
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Expected any of the following exception types: [IOException, IllegalStateException] but no exception was thrown.
	at __randomizedtesting.SeedInfo.seed([F1629301ED2AA739:CA39F823A7D722DF]:0)
	at org.apache.lucene.tests.util.LuceneTestCase.expectThrowsAnyOf(LuceneTestCase.java:2905)
```

issue.title: Fix flaky tests 'testDeleteAllAndListAllPits' and 'testDeleteWhileSearch'
issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request, here are some tips:

1. If this is a fix for an undisclosed security vulnerability, please STOP. All security vulnerability reporting and fixes should be done as per our security policy https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/security/policy
2. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md and developer guide https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/DEVELOPER_GUIDE.md
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/TESTING.md
-->

### Description
testDeleteAllAndListAllPits : 
List all PITs and delete all PITs both were triggered asynchronously and test was flaky in times where delete all finishes before get all. So fixed the test to order these two calls ( get will always finish first and then delete will be triggered )

testDeleteWhileSearch:
Added check for an error message which is also one of the valid scenarios

Tested using :

```
./gradlew ':client:rest-high-level:asyncIntegTest' --tests "org.opensearch.client.PitIT.testDeleteAllAndListAllPits" -Dtests.iters=1000

 ./gradlew ':server:internalClusterTest' --tests "org.opensearch.search.pit.DeletePitMultiNodeIT.testDeleteWhileSearch" -Dtests.iters=1000
```

### Related Issues

https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/issues/5030
https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/issues/9048

<!-- List any other related issues here -->

issue.title: Fix match_phrase_prefix_query not working on text field with multiple values and index_prefixes
issue.body:
### Description

When executing match_phrase_prefix_query on a text field with multiple values and setting `index_prefixes` to `true`, the  parameter `position_increment_gap` which defaults to 100 is not used by the sub-field `{text_field}._index_prefix`, this results in the spanNearQuery not working.

This change makes the sub-filed `{text_field}._index_prefix` using the value of `position_increment_gap` when indexing documents, so that a fake gap between multiple values are added. Some unit tests and yml test are added for this change.

### Related Issues

https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/issues/9203

### Check List
- [x] New functionality includes testing.
  - [x] All tests pass
- [x] New functionality has been documented.

pull_request.title: Fix match_phrase_prefix_query not working on text field with multiple values and index_prefixes
pull_request.body:
### Description

When executing match_phrase_prefix_query on a text field with multiple values and setting `index_prefixes` to `true`, the  parameter `position_increment_gap` which defaults to 100 is not used by the sub-field `{text_field}._index_prefix`, this results in the spanNearQuery not working.

This change makes the sub-filed `{text_field}._index_prefix` using the value of `position_increment_gap` when indexing documents, so that a fake gap between multiple values are added. Some unit tests and yml test are added for this change.

### Related Issues

https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/issues/9203

### Check List
- [ ] New functionality includes testing.
  - [ ] All tests pass
- [ ] New functionality has been documented.
  - [ ] New functionality has javadoc added

comment.body:
That is a good point. BTH I do not know how far the first 3.x release is.
It sounds to me that deprecation of `PathHierarchy` tokenizer name should have been deprecated at the same time as `nGrams` or `edgeGrams` but slipped under the radar. On one hand it is a breaking change so 3.x is a good opportunity to introduce it, on the other hand users should have enough time to prepare for this change.

I am open to any suggestions here.

comment.body: Seems related to the PR: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/pull/4266 where docValues have been enabled by default for geo_shape fields due to which Lucene is throwing [error](https://github.com/apache/lucene/blob/branch_9x/lucene/core/src/java/org/apache/lucene/index/FieldInfo.java#L275-L293)

issue.title: [BUG] Broken Upgrade from 2.7 to 2.9 for Indices with GeoShape mappings
